Description: Wheel-made pottery lamp with a flattened globular body, an unpierced lug on the left side, and a very short tapering nozzle. The filling-hole is surrounded by a narrow flat rim with a raised edge, set off from the shoulder by a groove. The raised base has string marks below. The upper surface has a red slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (q534)
